Question 2.Question:
Use the information below to answer the question.

On January 1 2005, a machine was bought for N 56,000 to last for 5 years with a residual value of N1,000.

Calculate the yearly depreciation expense using the straight line method
Question 2.Explanation:
Yearly deprecation = (Cost – Scrap value)/Useful life

= ₦(56,000 – 1,000)/5

= ₦55,000/5

= ₦11,000

Question 29.Question: If goods were bought from Tanko at a cost price of N 9,000 with a cash discount of 5%, how much will be paid assuming prompt payment was made?
Question 29.Explanation:
Amount paid

Discount = 5% x ₦9,000 = ₦450

Amount paid = ₦(9,000 - 450)

= ₦8,550

Question 30.Question: If machine X cost N 600,000 with anticipated life span for five years and estimated scrap value of N50,000, using straight line method; depreciation charged for two years will be
Question 30.Explanation:
Depreciation = (Cost – Scrap value)/Useful life

= ₦ (600,000 – 50,000)/5

= ₦550,000/5

Yearly depreciation = ₦110,000

For two years = ₦110,000 x 2

= ₦220,000

Question 47.Question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

ZEBRA PLC

Balance Sheet as at 31st March 2002

₦₦₦
Capital100,000Fixed assets:
Current Liabilities:Land and buildings50,000
Creditors30,000Furniture10,00060,000
Current assets:
Stock30,000
Debtors30,000
Cash10,00070,000
130,000130,000

The business was acquired on 1st April, 2002 at a purchase consideration of N120,000 by SOZ. All assets and liabilities were taken over except the cash. To open the new firms bank account, additional N20,000 was paid into the bank.

The goodwill on purchase is
Question 47.Explanation:
Goodwill = Purchases consideration - Net asset

= ₦120,000 - (Total asset - Current liabilities)

= N120,000 - (120,000 - 30,000)

= ₦30,000

N.B: Cash was not taken over

Calculate the net worth of the business
Question 48.Explanation:
Net worth = Total asset - Current liabilities (except Cash)

= ₦ (120,000 - 30,000)

= ₦90,000

Question 50.Question:
Mamsa Nigeria Limited issued 2,000 ordinary shares of ₦1.50 per share on 2nd July 2002. 1,500 ordinary shares were fully subscribed for and their monies received as below:

.₦
On application 0.40
On allotment 0.20
First call (including premium of ₦0.50)0.70

The last and final call was yet to be made.

What is the balance of the ordinary share capital account after the first call was received?
Question 50.Explanation:
On application = 1,500 x 0.40k = ₦600

On allotment = 1,500 x 0.2k = ₦300

On first call = 1,500 x 0.70k = ₦1,050

Balance after first call = ₦(600 + 300 + 1,050)

= ₦1,950
